abstract: Spanish centrist party Citizens emerges as key player in contentious upcoming elections; party's opposition to Catalan separatism, liberal economic stance and clean record resonates with voters weary of parties on political extremes; some question how well party's proposals will translate to practicalities of governing.
lead_paragraph: The party, Citizens, has expanded its base, shot up in the polls and unseated Spain’s other insurgent party, Podemos, as the rising threat to Spain’s established parties.

headline.main: In Spain, New Political Party Makes Gains From Surprising Place — the Center
headline.print_headline: In Spain, New Political Party Makes Gains From Surprising Place — the Center

snippet: The party, Citizens, has expanded its base, shot up in the polls and unseated Spain’s other insurgent party, Podemos, as the rising threat to Spain’s established parties.
